.NET Framework 4.6.name: NameAttribute
.NET Framework 4.6.summary: If a configuration item should be visible in the gui, it needs to be marked by this attribute to get a display name.
.NET Framework 4.6.example:
[Required] 
[Name(typeof(CoreStrings), "ProjectName")] 
public string ProjectName 
{ 
    get { /* ... */ } 
    set { /* ... */ } 
}

constructors.name: NameAttribute(Type localType, string displayName)
constructors.summary: The name attribute for a configuration item in a custom configuration section.

params.value: The type of the custom strings to get the title.
Name of the property to get the title.

constructors.syntax: public void NameAttribute(Type localType, string displayName)
constructors.linkedSyntax: public void NameAttribute(Type localType, string displayName)

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.summary: Name of the property to get the title.

properties.summary: The type of the custom strings to get the title.
